abstract: While Google’s Jaiku purchase may not seem like an earth-shaking event, some say it is the start of a truly interconnected world, where a chunk of our existence will migrate online.
snippet: While Google’s Jaiku purchase may not seem like an earth-shaking event, some say it is the start of a truly interconnected world, where a chunk of our existence will migrate online.
lead_paragraph: STOCKHOLM, Oct. 21 — Google’s acquisition of Jaiku, a small Finnish start-up active in the obscure field of microblogging — a word most often associated with the better-known company Twitter — might not appear to be an earth-shaking event.

headline.main: Google’s Purchase of Jaiku Raises New Privacy Issues
headline.print_headline: Google’s Purchase of Jaiku Raises New Privacy Issues

abstract: Several major research libraries have rebuffed offers from Google and Microsoft to scan their books, instead signing on with a nonprofit effort.
snippet: Several major research libraries have rebuffed offers from Google and Microsoft to scan their books, instead signing on with a nonprofit effort.
lead_paragraph: Several major research libraries have rebuffed offers from Google and Microsoft to scan their books into computer databases, saying they are put off by restrictions these companies want to place on the new digital collections.

headline.main: Libraries Shun Deals to Place Books on Web
headline.print_headline: LIBRARIES SHUN DEALS TO PLACE BOOKS ON WEB
